ThingDef.label: chicha morada
ThingDef.description:
A traditional beverage made from purple corn, spiced with cinnamon and cloves, and flavored with fruits like pineapple. Known for its rich, deep purple color and refreshing sweet-tart taste, chicha morada is not only a cultural staple but also rich in antioxidants due to the high anthocyanin content of purple corn.

<color=#E5E54C>Trade considerations:</color>

<color=#E5E54C>Ingredients:</color> Making 10 chicha morada requires corn, pineapple, spices and sugar for a total value of 99.40, and sells for 35, giving a <color=#33CC33>71.60%</color> profit per unit.

<color=#E5E54C>Value per work:</color> Recipe requires 7500 work, which results on a value per work of <color=#33CC33>0.05</color>.

<color=#E5E54C>Caravan trading:</color> Its weight is 0.3 Kg, for a value per Kg of <color=#33CC33>116.66</color>.

<color=#E5E54C>Profit per day:</color> On average, profit per day is <color=#33CC33>1.09</color> (for reference Yayo is 0.35).
